summary.honest_assessment: Most 'physics' tests were removed as inapplicable to classical embeddings

details.interpretation: XOR has 1 bit of irreducible integration
details.what_this_proves: Multi-Information correctly measures synergy in XOR systems

results.evidence: XOR I(X)=1.000 bits (expected 1.0), Independent I(X)=0.001 bits (expected 0.0)

details.honest_interpretation: This verifies SLERP is implemented correctly as geodesic
details.what_this_does_NOT_prove: It does NOT prove semantic space has special conservation laws
details.why: SLERP is geodesic BY DEFINITION on ANY unit sphere

details.why_removed: Test claimed 'holographic scaling' but actually tested centroid estimation
details.what_it_actually_tested: Can you estimate mean from a subset? (Yes - Central Limit Theorem)
details.why_wrong: Ryu-Takayanagi requires AdS bulk geometry and CFT boundary entropy
details.honest_conclusion: Classical embeddings have no holographic duality

results.evidence: 100% of word pairs have monotonic similarity along SLERP

details.why_removed: Bell inequalities test quantum entanglement; embeddings are classical
details.what_it_would_prove: Nothing - classical systems always satisfy Bell bounds
details.previous_bug: Test used independent noise (no correlation by construction)
details.honest_conclusion: Classical embeddings cannot violate Bell inequalities

results.evidence: REMOVED - Bell inequality is inapplicable to classical vectors

details.why_removed: P_born = n * E^2 by algebra, regardless of physics
details.honest_conclusion: Cannot test Born rule with classical embeddings (no complex amplitudes)

results.evidence: REMOVED - Tested an algebraic identity, not the Born rule

details.why_removed: Was identical to Test 2 (SLERP is geodesic by definition)
details.both_tests_proved: SLERP is correctly implemented as geodesic

results.source: REMOVED - Measured random geometry, not holonomy

details.why_removed: Test measured non-planarity of 4 random points, not parallel transport
details.what_it_actually_measured: Do 4 arbitrary words lie in a 2D plane? (No, trivially)
details.what_real_holonomy_requires: Parallel transport around a semantic path
details.numerical_fact: Any 4 random unit vectors in d>3 have non-zero spherical excess

results.evidence: REMOVED - Measured random geometry, not semantic curvature

details.interpretation: Semantic angles deviate 13.3 deg from random

results.evidence: Mean pairwise angle = 76.7 deg (random would be 90 deg)
